chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
Ens -> Ens

Premises:
Inductive Ens : Type := sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens Arguments sup _%type_scope _%function_scope
Couple = fun E E' : Ens => Paire (Sing E) (Paire Vide (Sing E')) : Ens -> Ens -> Ens
Sing = fun E : Ens => Paire E E : Ens -> Ens
INC = fun E1 E2 : Ens => forall E : Ens, IN E E1 -> IN E E2 : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Paire = fun E E' : Ens => sup bool (fun H : bool => bool_rect (fun _ : bool => Ens) E E' H) : Ens -> Ens -> Ens
Succ = fun E : Ens => Union (Paire E (Sing E)) : Ens -> Ens
EQ = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens -> Prop) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (eq1 : A -> Ens -> Prop) (X0 : Ens) => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Prop) (fun (B : Type) (g : B -> Ens) (_ : B -> Prop) => (forall x : A, EXType B (fun y : B => eq1 x (g y))) /\ (forall y : B, EXType A (fun x : A => eq1 x (g y)))) X0) X : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
pi1 = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Type) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (_ : A -> Type) => A) X : Ens -> Type
IN_Prod_EXType : forall E E' E'' : Ens, IN E'' (Prod E E') -> EXType Ens (fun A : Ens => EXType Ens (fun B : Ens => EQ (Couple A B) E''))
IN = fun E1 E2 : Ens => match E2 with | sup A f => EXType A (fun y : A => EQ E1 (f y)) end : Ens -> Ens -> Prop
Prod = fun E E' : Ens => match E with | sup A f => match E' with | sup A' f' => sup (prod_t A A') (fun c : prod_t A A' => match c with | @pair_t _ _ a a' => Couple (f a) (f' a') end) end end : Ens -> Ens -> Ens
Comp = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => (Ens -> Prop) -> Ens) (fun (A : Type) (f : A -> Ens) (_ : A -> (Ens -> Prop) -> Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop) => sup (sig A (fun x : A => P (f x))) (fun X0 : sig A (fun x : A => P (f x)) => sig_rect A (fun x : A => P (f x)) (fun _ : sig A (fun x : A => P (f x)) => Ens) (fun (x : A) (_ : P (f x)) => f x) X0)) X : Ens -> (Ens -> Prop) -> Ens Arguments Comp _ _%function_scope
sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens
Union_IN : forall E E' : Ens, IN E' (Union E) -> EXType Ens (fun E1 : Ens => IN E1 E /\ IN E' E1)
pi2 : forall E : Ens, pi1 E -> Ens
Power = fun E : Ens => match E with | sup A f => sup (A -> Prop) (fun P : A -> Prop => sup (depprod A (fun a : A => P a)) (fun c : depprod A (fun a : A => P a) => match c with | @dep_i _ _ a _ => f a end)) end : Ens -> Ens
Comp_INC : forall (E : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), INC (Comp E P) E
Union = fun E : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens) (fun (A : Type) (f _ : A -> Ens) => sup (depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x))) (fun X : depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) => depprod_rect A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) (fun _ : depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) => Ens) (fun (a : A) (b : pi1 (f a)) => pi2 (f a) b) X)) E : Ens -> Ens
Vide = sup F (fun f : F => match f return Ens with end) : Ens
IN_Comp_P : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A (Comp E P) -> P A
IN_P_Comp : forall (E A : Ens) (P : Ens -> Prop), (forall w1 w2 : Ens, P w1 -> EQ w1 w2 -> P w2) -> IN A E -> P A -> IN A (Comp E P)
Ens_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_rect : forall P : Ens -> Type, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_sind : forall P : Ens -> SProp, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Ens_rec : forall P : Ens -> Set, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Omega = sup nat Nat : Ens
Nat = fun H : nat => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => Ens) Vide (fun (_ : nat) (X : Ens) => Succ X) H : nat -> Ens Arguments Nat _%nat_scope
Inter = fun E : Ens => match E with | sup A f => sup (depprod A (fun a : A => depprod (pi1 (f a)) (fun b : pi1 (f a) => forall x : A, IN (pi2 (f a) b) (f x)))) (fun c : depprod A (fun a : A => depprod (pi1 (f a)) (fun b : pi1 (f a) => forall x : A, IN (pi2 (f a) b) (f x))) => match c with | @dep_i _ _ a (@dep_i _ _ b _) => pi2 (f a) b end) end : Ens -> Ens
Inductive Ord : Ens -> Prop := Oo : Ord Vide | So : forall E : Ens, Ord E -> Ord (Succ E) | Lo : forall E : Ens, (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> Ord e) -> Ord (Union E) | Eo : forall E E' : Ens, Ord E -> EQ E E' -> Ord E' Arguments Lo _ _%function_scope
Ord_ind : forall P : Ens -> Prop, P Vide -> (forall E : Ens, Ord E -> P E -> P (Succ E)) -> (forall E : Ens, (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> Ord e) -> (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> P e) -> P (Union E)) -> (forall E E' : Ens, Ord E -> P E -> EQ E E' -> P E') -> forall e : Ens, Ord e -> P e
Ord_sind : forall P : Ens -> SProp, P Vide -> (forall E : Ens, Ord E -> P E -> P (Succ E)) -> (forall E : Ens, (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> Ord e) -> (forall e : Ens, IN e E -> P e) -> P (Union E)) -> (forall E E' : Ens, Ord E -> P E -> EQ E E' -> P E') -> forall e : Ens, Ord e -> P e
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
Field_theory.FEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Field_theory.FExpr C -> R
Field_theory.PCond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Field_theory.Fnorm : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Field_theory.FExpr C -> Field_theory.linear C
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Field_theory.NPEpow : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> BinNums.N -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
Field_theory.split : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Field_theory.rsplit C
